intro: Vandenboschia, commonly known as the African ice plant, is a succulent plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, which is known for its unique adaptations to arid environments. The plant features fleshy, water-storing leaves that help it survive in dry conditions. It produces small, star-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink, often blooming in spring. Vandenboschia is well-suited for rock gardens and xeriscaping due to its low water requirements and ornamental appeal.
